Description: The primary objective of this qualification is to prepare and equip students with essential financial, analytical, and managerial skills for success in commerce and industry. Completing this program provides a strong foundation in key areas, enabling graduates to excel in professional settings. It aims to cultivate competencies necessary for making informed financial decisions, analysing data, and managing resources effectively in the dynamic landscape of commerce and industry.

Description: The primary purpose of this qualification is to provide students with a comprehensive undergraduate education that serves as a solid foundation for pursuing further studies in the field of accounting, specifically the Chartered Accountant (CA) route. Graduates will be well-prepared to enter a CTA (Certificate in the Theory of Accounting) program, a necessary step towards achieving the designation of Chartered Accountant CA (SA). This qualification also prepares students to practice as Registered General Accountants, positioning them within the second tier of the proposed four-tier accounting structure in Southern Africa.
